result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Heckendorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Jury Trial Day 4 of 4).

COURT revokes Defendant's Bond.

2:10 PM- Adjourned. 

Defendant remanded to custody of Marathon County Sheriff's Department.

Case Called: 8:32 am
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Peter Rotter.
Date and time to address the State's Motion to Admit other acts.

State moves to dismiss Ct. 1 in the Information filed-COURT GRANTS. 
Parties make arguments to Motion. COURT addresses the parties. 
COURT makes rulings on the Other Acts that can and cannot be admitted. 
COURT ALLOWS the 1984 act under the Other Acts. COURT ALLOWS Summer of 1974 under the Other Acts. Earlier acts may not be admitted.
Parties have a joint recommendation for an adjournment. COURT Grants Adjournment. 
COURT denies Defense's Motion for State to disclose names to Defense.
Parties are to reset Trial date with JA.

AMENDED. Includes 14CF1052 and 15CM770.  No contact with victim(s): H.W. dob 6/14/1973 and J.H. dob 4/28/1982 and No contact with individuals under age 18 years.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  NOT TO BE PRESENT IN ANY LOCATION WHERE CHILDREN MAY BE PRESENT.
